intro: Prockia serrata, commonly known as the serrated prockia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. Native to certain regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a slender, branched stem and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
